Mobile Setup Guide

Aviation Test Center - How to use on Samsung/Android phones

üö® Important for Mobile Users

The START_APP.bat and START_APP.sh files only work on computers (Windows/Mac/Linux). On mobile phones, you need to use one of the methods below.

üåê Method 1: Free Web Hosting EASIEST RECOMMENDED
1. Go to Netlify Drop on your phone or computer
2. Drag the entire extracted folder onto the page
3. You'll get a link like: https://amazing-app-123.netlify.app
4. Share this link with anyone - works on ALL devices!
5. The app stays online forever, free!
Open Netlify Drop ‚Üí
üì≤ Method 2: Mobile Server App REQUIRES APP
1. Download "HTTP Server - WiFi File Share" from Play Store
2. Extract this ZIP file on your phone
3. Open the HTTP Server app
4. Select the extracted aviation-test-app folder
5. Tap "Start Server"
6. Open the URL shown (e.g., http://192.168.1.5:8080)
üåç Method 3: Try Different Browsers LIMITED
Some browsers handle local files better than others:
‚úÖ Firefox - Works best on Android
‚ö†Ô∏è Chrome - May work with limitations
‚ùå Samsung Internet - Usually doesn't work
Try opening index.html with Firefox browser

‚ùì Why doesn't it work directly?

Mobile browsers have strict security rules. When you open an HTML file directly (using file:// protocol), the browser blocks:

  • Loading CSS files ‚Üí No styles, buttons not visible
  • Loading JavaScript ‚Üí No functionality
  • Loading data files ‚Üí No test questions

Solution: The app must be served via http:// or https:// using one of the methods above.

üíª For Desktop Users:
On Windows: Double-click START_APP.bat
On Mac/Linux: Double-click START_APP.sh
The browser will open automatically at http://localhost:8000

For more detailed instructions, see MOBILE_INSTRUCTIONS.md

Need help? Make sure you're following Method 1 - it's the easiest!
